channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: curated by Hodljuice
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: Bitcoin Optech: Bitcoin Optech: Newsletter #348 Recap
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Optech
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin technology, secp256k1, BIP proposals, wallet releases
item.description: In this episode, the hosts Mark “Murch” Erhardt and Mike Schmidt, along with guests, review Newsletter #348. They discuss various technical topics including a new educational implementation of secp256k1, the debate on whether compromised bitcoins should be destroyed, and methods for proving UTXO ownership using SHA256. They also cover draft BIP proposals such as CTV and a draft for quantum-insecure bitcoin destruction, while highlighting recent wallets and code changes in the Bitcoin ecosystem.

item.title: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast: S16 E21: Filip Baturan on Tanari, Citrea & DeFi on Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: DeFi, Bitcoin adoption, user experience, self-custody
item.description: In this episode, Filip Baturan, CEO of Tanari, discusses how their decentralized finance application aims to enhance Bitcoin's usability while ensuring self-custody. The conversation contrasts Tanari's vision with existing financial systems, emphasizing features such as ease of use and secure Bitcoin storage. Challenges of balancing user-friendliness with privacy are addressed, along with the broader implications of integrating Bitcoin into financial primitives. The episode concludes with insights into the future of Finance on Bitcoin.

item.title: Bitcoin for Millennials: Modern Money Is Ruining You (Most People Have No Clue) | Will Reeves | BFM145
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Millennials
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin adoption, financial behavior, rewards systems, legacy financial system
item.description: Will Reeves, the CEO of Fold, discusses how Bitcoin aims to empower individuals by promoting the value of saving within a flawed financial system. The episode explains how Fold is transforming from rewards to broader financial services, facilitating the transition from fiat to Bitcoin through familiar tools. Reeves highlights the psychological shift needed for Bitcoin adoption and critiques the obstacles in the legacy system that discourage saving.

item.title: Coin Stories: News Block: Market Tumbles as Foreign Investors Sell U.S. Assets, Gold Hits New ATH, Trump Demands "Too Late" Powell Lower Rates, Bitcoin Shows Resilience
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Macro economics, Bitcoin market trends, U.S. assets, monetary policy
item.description: This episode covers major financial headlines impacting Bitcoin and the global economy. Key discussions include the sell-off of U.S. assets by foreign investors, the spike in gold prices, and President Trump's pressure on the Federal Reserve regarding interest rates. The episode also reflects on Bitcoin's resilience amidst market fluctuations and regulatory changes affecting cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Pleb Underground: Joey (Canadian Bitcoin Podcast) Joins Pleb Underground
item.itunes:author: Pleb Underground
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin content creation, marketing strategies, community engagement
item.description: In this live episode, hosts explore the field of Bitcoin content creation with guest Joey. They discuss the marketing complexities faced by creators and debate the emphasis on genuine messaging versus click-driven strategies. The conversation delves into the ethos of Bitcoin-only content and the balance between promotion and authenticity in the community.

item.title: Robin Seyer: Why You’ll Regret Not Owning Bitcoin: Earn 5X More than You Spend by 2030!
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin adoption, financial literacy, borrowing risks, market predictions
item.description: Robin Seyer and Stephan Livera discuss the evolution of Bitcoin education and its implications for adoption. They contrast retail versus institutional interest and stress the importance of self-custody for real ownership. The episode also touches on the risks associated with borrowing against Bitcoin and the evolving landscape of Bitcoin ETFs, alongside the necessary cultural shifts for mainstream acceptance.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast: #609: How To Summon A UAP with Matt Pines
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: UAP phenomena, data collection, consciousness, geopolitics
item.description: Host Marty interviews Matt Pines to explore Skywatcher's quest for empirical data on Unidentified Aerial Phenomena (UAPs). The discussion spans various topics including U.S. government disclosure, data collection methods, and the intersection of UAP phenomena with consciousness and geopolitics. Insights include a futuristic look at AI's role and the potential implications for Bitcoin as a transformative agent in society.

item.title: The Bugle Weekly: Bugle Easter Special | Bugle Weekly Episode 56
item.itunes:author: The Bugle Weekly
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin developments, market trends, regulatory changes
item.description: In this episode, hosts Rod and Dick discuss significant Bitcoin news from the past week, focusing on important developments and market trends affecting the cryptocurrency landscape. They provide insights into the implications of recent regulatory changes and include notable opinions from industry leaders, offering listeners a comprehensive overview of the current Bitcoin environment.

item.title: The What is Money Show: Ideas Having Sex: How Money & Language Evolve Civilization w/ Matt Ridley (WiM574)
item.itunes:author: The What is Money Show
item.itunes:keywords: Evolution of money, cultural progress, Bitcoin significance
item.description: Matt Ridley joins the show to discuss how concepts like money and language evolve within society. The conversation highlights the collective memory role of money and the evolutionary nature of ideas, drawing parallels between various thinkers. Ridley proposes that Bitcoin represents a pivotal shift in the evolution of money, while also reflecting on historical responses to modern challenges such as Covid.

item.title: Why Bitcoin: Cryptosovereignty - BitcoinBrilliance002
item.itunes:author: Why Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin philosophy, self-custody, political implications
item.description: Erik Cason, a Bitcoin philosopher, discusses his book on cryptosovereignty and Bitcoin's implications beyond the realm of finance. He examines how Bitcoin’s cryptography enhances personal freedom and challenges government authority. The conversation touches on how Bitcoin redefines sovereignty and the necessity of understanding its societal impacts for a deeper comprehension of its role in the current landscape.

item.title: Bitcoin Audible: Read 877 - Once in a Species
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Evolution of money, scarcity, human behavior, value systems
item.description: Jesse Myers discusses how humanity's fascination with rare objects may have played a crucial role in our evolution. This episode explores the origins of money and its fundamental role in civilizations, suggesting that rather than intelligence or strength, our unique behaviors towards scarce assets may define our species. We also look into the implications these insights have for understanding value in the future.

item.title: Bitcoin Made Simple Podcast: BMS 180 - Jesus and the Den of Thieves
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Made Simple Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Truth-seeking, personal growth, honesty, life journey
item.description: On this episode, Cory reflects on his relentless pursuit of truth and its profound impact on his life. The discussion centers on how honesty and personal growth are interlinked, highlighting the transformative power of seeking the truth.

item.title: Bitcoin Magazine Podcast: MMA Champion Cris Cyborg: Fighting Inflation with Bitcoin | The Culture Bit
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Magazine Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin advocacy, inflation, personal journey, athlete resilience
item.description: MMA champion Cris Cyborg shares her journey into Bitcoin, influenced by inflation in Brazil. In this conversation, she discusses the significance of Bitcoin for athletes and families, shedding light on her motivations for advocating Bitcoin since 2018. This episode serves as an inspiring narrative ahead of her participation in Bitcoin 2025.

item.title: Bitcoin Park: TEMS25: Econoalchemist on how the 256Foundation is Open Sourcing a Closed Industry
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Park
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin mining, open-source solutions, decentralization, industry challenges
item.description: This episode focuses on the Texas Energy and Mining Summit and the 256 Foundation's initiative to promote open-source solutions in the Bitcoin mining industry. The discussion highlights the challenges of proprietary technologies and the need for community engagement and innovation to support decentralization and efficiency in Bitcoin mining.

item.title: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast: S16 E20: Felix Billbert on Wave Space & Spending Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin adoption, regulatory challenges, financial services, philosophy in finance
item.description: Felix Billbert, Chief Maximalist at Wave Space, discusses the company's efforts to facilitate Bitcoin spending in Europe amidst challenging regulations. The conversation covers compliance complexities, competitive landscape, and the philosophical implications of Bitcoin's adoption in daily life, emphasizing self-custody and innovation in financial tools.

item.title: Bitcoin for PEACE: Bitcoin for Spiritual Seekers - Scott Dedels - Dao of Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for PEACE
item.itunes:keywords: Spirituality, Bitcoin advocacy, innovation in finance, personal transformation
item.description: In this episode, Scott Dedels shares his journey from financial services to becoming a Bitcoin advocate, intertwining Bitcoin principles with Daoist philosophy. He discusses challenges with regulatory barriers in finance and how Bitcoin can foster personal and spiritual transformation, emphasizing the innovative potential in Bitcoin technology for small businesses.

item.title: I Am Texas Slim: Barriers to Entry: Tariffs, US Cattlemen, and Beef Maps
item.itunes:author: I Am Texas Slim
item.itunes:keywords: Agriculture, beef industry, tariffs, consumer rights
item.description: This episode explores the hidden costs of imported beef and the challenges faced by small US cattle producers. It highlights the dominance of non-American beef in US markets, the realities behind labeling, and innovative solutions like direct-to-consumer sales that are disrupting the cattle industry, advocating for awareness and consumer choice.

item.title: Onramp Media: Still Early: Bitcoin’s Mispricing, ETF Flows, & the Quiet Race to Accumulate
item.itunes:author: Onramp Media
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin investment, economic dynamics, market sentiment

They discuss the effect of government stances on Bitcoin and the generational divide in asset allocation while providing insights into future market developments and corporate adoption.

item.itunes:keywords: Institutional adoption, Bitcoin ETFs, financial responsibility, market dynamics

The episode highlights the concerns surrounding government involvement, Bitcoin price manipulations, and stresses individual financial responsibility while navigating the evolving roles of Bitcoin as it gains acceptance among institutions.

item.title: Bitcoin Magazine Podcast: BitBonds: The $2 TRILLION Plan to Fix America's Debt Crisis | Bitcoin Backstage feat. Alex McShane
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Magazine Podcast

Key topics include the implications of BitBonds on U.S. fiscal policy and the potential future of Bitcoin in federal finance.
